text.p: Digital Equipment Corp said on Thursday it filed a lawsuit against California-based Altavista Technology Inc for alleged infringement of Digital's AltaVista trademark.
Digital said it bought all of Altavista Technology's rights to the AltaVista trademark in March, then licensed very limited and specific uses of it back to Altavista.

The suit, filed in a Massachusetts District Court, sought to stop Altavista Technology from allegedly infringing and diluting this trademark, the company said. It also sought damages for alleged past infringement, the company said.
Digital, which has a subsidiary called AltaVista Internet software, said its complaint alleged that Altavista used the trademark in ways which breached the deal, the company said.
Altavista was not immediately available to comment.

The suit alleged that, among other things, Altavista's Web page confused Internet users and advertisers about the source of the AltaVista Internet search service, which Digital offers, the company said.
Digital also said before taking legal action, it repeatedly asked Altavista Technology to comply with the agreement. -- New York newsdesk 212-859-1610
